holidays.name: Plant a Flower Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to celebrate nature's blooms by planting a flower and adding beauty to your surroundings.
holidays.origin: Started by garden enthusiasts to encourage people to connect with nature and brighten up their environment as spring begins in many parts of the world.
holidays.funFact: Plant a Flower Day perfectly coincides with early spring, when many flowers are just beginning to sprout, making it the ideal day to start a garden!

holidays.name: Girl Scouts Day
holidays.description: Honors the founding of the Girl Scouts of the USA, celebrating community, leadership, and outdoor skills for girls.
holidays.origin: Established to commemorate the founding of Girl Scouts in 1912 by Juliette Gordon Low in Savannah, Georgia.
holidays.funFact: Juliette Gordon Low started the Girl Scouts with just 18 girls ‚Äì now there are millions worldwide!

holidays.name: National Alfred Hitchcock Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the master of suspense, Alfred Hitchcock, and his iconic contributions to cinema.
holidays.origin: Unofficially recognized by film fans on Hitchcock's birthday, March 12, 1899.
holidays.funFact: Hitchcock appeared in cameo roles in 39 of his movies, a tradition beloved by fans trying to spot him.

holidays.name: International Day of Action Against Police Brutality
holidays.description: A serious day of global protest and awareness to speak out against police violence and seek justice and reform.
holidays.origin: Initiated in 1997 by a coalition of activist groups to coincide with the anniversary of the police killings of three Black youth in Montreal in 1995.
holidays.funFact: Though serious in nature, this day has sparked worldwide marches every year, highlighting the power of collective action.

holidays.name: National Meatball Day
holidays.description: A deliciously fun day to celebrate the iconic and versatile meatball in all its culinary glory!
holidays.origin: Created by food lovers to honor the worldwide love of meatballs, which appear in cuisines from Italy to Sweden to Asia.
holidays.funFact: Meatballs made their way into American cuisine thanks to Italian immigrants, and the day encourages you to try new meatball recipes!
